# Search Result
From [Source](https://cedmohub.eu/posts-share-doctored-prisoner-abuse-poll-from-israeli-tv-channel/): 
Content: "The false posts emerged after the news channel broadcast footage that appeared to show Israeli soldiers sexually abusing Palestinian prisoners at a military base.** 

“Israel’s Channel 12 asked a question in an Israeli public opinion poll: Do you agree with the claim that a soldier is allowed to rape a prisoner with his hands tied? <image:6696>

Screenshot of the statement by Channel 12 posted on X, taken on August 22

AFP has fact-checked more misinformation around the Israel-Hamas war [here](https://factcheck.afp.com/list/Israeli-Palestinian-conflict)
.

![Fact Checker Logo](https://cedmo.wpengine.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/afp-logo-256.png)

Originally published [here](https://factcheck.afp.com/doc.afp.com.36F888X)
.

[Meta fact-check](https://cedmohub.eu/tag/meta-2/)

[](https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fcedmohub.eu%2Fposts-share-doctored-prisoner-abuse-poll-from-israeli-tv-channel%2F "Facebook")
[](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Posts+share+doctored+%26%238216%3Bprisoner+abuse+poll%26%238217%3B+from+Israeli+TV+channel&url=https%3A%2F%2Fcedmohub.eu%2Fposts-share-doctored-prisoner-abuse-poll-from-israeli-tv-channel%2F "Twitter")
[](https://pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcedmohub.eu%2Fposts-share-doctored-prisoner-abuse-poll-from-israeli-tv-channel%2F&description=Posts+share+doctored+%26%238216%3Bprisoner+abuse+poll%26%238217%3B+from+Israeli+TV+channel&media=https%3A%2F%2Fcedmohub.eu%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2024%2F09%2Fbfdb57e90ac2b3ae59b4041b1da145361b724005-ipad-thegem-blog-timeline-large.jpg "Pinterest")
[](https://www.tumblr.com/widgets/share/tool?canonicalUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fcedmohub.eu%2Fposts-share-doctored-prisoner-abuse-poll-from-israeli-tv-channel%2F "Tumblr")
[](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fcedmohub.eu%2Fposts-share-doctored-prisoner-abuse-poll-from-israeli-tv-channel%2F&title=Posts+share+doctored+%26%238216%3Bprisoner+abuse+poll%26%238217%3B+from+Israeli+TV+channel&summary=%22Israel%27s+Channel+12+asked+a+question+in+an+Israeli+public+opinion+poll%3A+Do+you+agree+with+the+claim+that+a+soldier+is+allowed+to+rape+a+prisoner+with+his+hands+tied%3F+47%25+Yes+43%25+No%2C%22+read+the+caption+alongside+the+altered+image+posted+on%C2%A0Facebook+on+August+11. <image:6694>

Screenshot of the false post, taken August 22, 2024

The posts emerged online after the United States [urged](https://www.barrons.com/news/us-urges-israel-to-probe-video-of-prison-sex-abuse-6316ea67)
 Israel to investigate and implement accountability following the circulation of a video that appeared to show soldiers sexually abusing a Palestinian prisoner on August 7 ([archived link](https://web.archive.org/web/20240822070528/https://www.barrons.com/news/us-urges-israel-to-probe-video-of-prison-sex-abuse-6316ea67)
).

The leaked surveillance video, broadcast on Channel 12, showed Israel soldiers hiding behind shields in what online commentators suggested was sexual acts performed on a prisoner the Sde Teiman base.

The Israeli military said it has opened an [investigation](https://www.barrons.com/news/israel-army-opens-probe-into-suspected-abuse-of-detainee-cf341d85)
 into “suspected abuse” of a detainee at the facility, known to be holding Palestinians arrested from Gaza during the war ([archived link](https://perma.cc/JAJ6-FJ6U)
).

Channel 12 hosted a [controversial debate](https://www.the7eye.org.il/526413)
 on August 7 in which panellists discussed whether the rape and abuse of Palestinian prisoners should be legalised ([archived link](https://perma.cc/A49R-S47W)
).

The war was triggered by Hamas’s unprecedented October 7 attack on Israel, which resulted in the deaths of 1,205 people, mostly civilians, according to an [AFP tally](https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20240903-israel-pm-unbowed-by-pressure-as-gaza-war-rages-on)
 based on Israeli official figures ([archived link](https://web.archive.org/web/20240904021154/https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20240903-israel-pm-unbowed-by-pressure-as-gaza-war-rages-on)
).

Israel’s retaliatory military campaign to destroy Hamas has killed 40,819 people, according to the health ministry in the Hamas-run territory.

The altered image was shared on Facebook by users based in [Malaysia](https://web.archive.org/web/20240822013834/https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fzinnirahmuthalif%2Fposts%2Fpfbid023SwxWmk3NXhVA2xDdnruaXAqhSAH7y6FNtfppVPESkD7YZbhuyLyJ2n5nEcHWexNl&show_text=true&width=500)
 and [Singapore](https://web.archive.org/web/20240822014040/https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fyanies14%2Fposts%2Fpfbid0MfEF2xoJ9w8YDfzj6JoTMzRmioadtsVRFNyU1F98tgA9MpsxZDA8YErHMRBd3tukl&show_text=true&width=500)
.

Similar false posts were also shared on social media platform X in [Pakistan](https://perma.cc/4PCV-CGAV)
 and the [United Kingdom](https://perma.cc/52PV-SRBE)
.

**Altered screenshot**

A reverse image search on Google found the [original footage](https://www.mako.co.il/news-channel12?subChannelId=b91e54300a2ef710VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD&vcmid=622e1dba8a601810VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD)
 of the news bulletin segment published by Channel 12 on its website on May 27, 2022 ([archived link](https://web.archive.org/web/20240822070753/https://www.mako.co.il/news-channel12?subChannelId=b91e54300a2ef710VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD&vcmid=622e1dba8a601810VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD)
).

The two-minute, six-second video shows an anchor presenting the news alongside the survey results that read in Hebrew: “Do you agree with the claim that the government relies on supporters of terrorism?”

The video’s Hebrew-language title translates to English as: “A year for the government: a survey of mandates”.

The timestamp for the clip screenshot used in the misleading post can be seen at the one-minute 46-second mark.

In the manipulated image, a blue box covered the screen, hiding the original question that was displayed with the results on a screen behind the news anchor.

Channel 12 subsequently apologised for the poll, Israeli newspaper Haaretz [reported](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-10-02/ty-article/.premium/leading-israeli-news-channel-apologizes-for-terror-supporters-poll/0000018a-f13e-dfa2-a99e-f97fd6ea0000)
 ([archived link](https://perma.cc/69VL-H7AJ)
).

Below is a screenshot comparison of the altered image (left) and the original video published by Channel 12 (right):

! 47% Yes 43% No,” read the caption alongside the altered image posted on [Facebook](https://web.archive.org/web/20240822013834/https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fzinnirahmuthalif%2Fposts%2Fpfbid023SwxWmk3NXhVA2xDdnruaXAqhSAH7y6FNtfppVPESkD7YZbhuyLyJ2n5nEcHWexNl&show_text=true&width=500)
 on August 11.

The image appeared to show a news presenter from Israel’s Channel 12 standing next to a poll graphic with a Hebrew-language question that translates as: “Do you agree that a soldier is allowed to rape a “terrorist”?”

! Za akékoľvek použitie obsahu AFP nesiete výhradnú a plnú zodpovednosť.

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from cedmohub.eu, published on September 4, 2024, states that the image is a doctored screenshot. The original footage was published by Channel 12 on May 27, 2022. The original question was: “Do you agree with the claim that the government relies on supporters of terrorism?” <image:6696>, <image:6694>, <image:6695>. Channel 12 said they did not broadcast the purported poll.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://komonews.com/news/nation-world/squad-member-shares-fake-poll-claiming-most-israelis-support-rape-of-palestinians-rashida-tlaib-noura-erakat-alex-zeldin-ritchie-torres-israel-palestine-hamas-war-terrorism-gaza): 
Content: "

The screenshots show the image originally shared by Erakat said 47% of respondents answered "yes" to a poll asking "do you agree that a soldier is allowed to rape a Palestinian?" Various X users later claimed the image was a doctored version of a 2022 Channel 12 poll, which asked respondents about the Israeli government's relationship with "terrorist supporters."

An analysis of a May 27, 2022 Channel 12 [broadcast](https://www.mako.co.il/news-channel12?subChannelId=b91e54300a2ef710VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD&vcmid=622e1dba8a601810VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD "https://www.mako.co.il/news-channel12?subChannelId=b91e54300a2ef710VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD&vcmid=622e1dba8a601810VgnVCM200000650a10acRCRD")
 by The National Desk (TND) confirmed the claims.

[Noura Erakat](/topic/Noura%20Erakat)
[Channel 12](/topic/Channel%2012)

WASHINGTON (TND) — Rep. Erakat's now-deleted X post contained a doctored image of a poll seemingly conducted by Israel's Channel 12, according to [screenshots](https://x.com/yashar/status/1821337704711516313 "https://x.com/yashar/status/1821337704711516313")
 shared by users. Tlaib trusted me & posting this \[without\] cross checking was my mistake."  

"But surely u understand how one would take this poll to be true in light of video of gang rape of a Palestinian detainee & Knesset + public debate on whether such rape should be ok," she added. "THAT is the disgrace, Alex."  

When reached for comment, Erakat reiterated to TND that it is "not a leap or a stretch" to believe such a poll would have been published by Channel 12. She noted the image circulated shortly after video was released of an alleged gang rape of a Palestinian prisoner by Israeli soldiers at detention facilitySde Teiman.

State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller on Wednesday called for an investigation related to the video, emphasizing claims of sexual abuse atSde Teiman are "horrific." Israel's Supreme Court has repeatedly convened to consider closingthe facility.

Erakat told TND it is "devastating" for Palestinian-Americans to see such footage, adding both a lack of media coverage and the outrage she and Rep. <image:6699>](https://komonews.com/game-center#/games/guessword)

'Squad' member shares fake poll claiming most Israelis support rape of Palestinians
===================================================================================

* * *

by KRISTINA WATROBSKI | The National Desk

Fri, August 9th 2024 at 1:45 PM

Updated Fri, August 9th 2024 at 3:36 PM

![UserWay icon for accessibility widget](/resources/defaults/news_3.0/icons/accessibility/userway-transparent.svg)

![FILE - Rep. Tlaib drew backlash for sharing the post, including from Forward columnist Alex Zeldin, who [called](https://x.com/JewishWonk/status/1821335110844575919 "https://x.com/JewishWonk/status/1821335110844575919")
 the congresswoman "a disgrace."

"Why is Rashida Tlaib, a Member of Congress, openly distributing fake polls claiming an American ally is pro-rape?" Zeldin wrote on X. Ritchie Torres, D-N.Y., also [condemned](https://x.com/RitchieTorres/status/1821941043035594962 "https://x.com/RitchieTorres/status/1821941043035594962")
 the doctored image, calling "disinformation" a "new enemy of Israel on the social media age."

> A fake poll falsely accusing Israelis of endorsing rape against Palestinians is dangerous disinformation designed to delegitimize and demonize both the Jewish People and the Jewish State," the congressman said. Fri, 29 Aug 2025 12:13:56 GMT (1756469636580)

65% of Israeli Jews oppose criminal prosecution for soldiers suspected of raping Palestinian detainees
======================================================================================================

A shocking new poll shows that almost two out of three Jewish Israelis oppose criminal prosecution for soldiers suspected of gang-raping Palestinian detainees at the Sde Teiman torture facility.

[](https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/bluesky?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fmondoweiss.net%2F2024%2F08%2F65-of-israeli-jews-oppose-criminal-prosecution-for-soldiers-suspected-of-raping-palestinian-detainees%2F&linkname=65%25%20of%20Israeli%20Jews%20oppose%20criminal%20prosecution%20for%20soldiers%20suspected%20of%20raping%20Palestinian%20detainees "Bluesky")
[](https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/reddit?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fmondoweiss.net%2F2024%2F08%2F65-of-israeli-jews-oppose-criminal-prosecution-for-soldiers-suspected-of-raping-palestinian-detainees%2F&linkname=65%25%20of%20Israeli%20Jews%20oppose%20criminal%20prosecution%20for%20soldiers%20suspected%20of%20raping%20Palestinian%20detainees "Reddit")
[](https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/email?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fmondoweiss.net%2F2024%2F08%2F65-of-israeli-jews-oppose-criminal-prosecution-for-soldiers-suspected-of-raping-palestinian-detainees%2F&linkname=65%25%20of%20Israeli%20Jews%20oppose%20criminal%20prosecution%20for%20soldiers%20suspected%20of%20raping%20Palestinian%20detainees "Email")
[](https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/print?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fmondoweiss.net%2F2024%2F08%2F65-of-israeli-jews-oppose-criminal-prosecution-for-soldiers-suspected-of-raping-palestinian-detainees%2F&linkname=65%25%20of%20Israeli%20Jews%20oppose%20criminal%20prosecution%20for%20soldiers%20suspected%20of%20raping%20Palestinian%20detainees "Print")

A shocking [poll](https://www.inss.org.il/he/publication/august-2024/)
 published on August 18 by the Israeli Institute for National Security Studies surveys attitudes concerning various aspects of what Israel calls “Swords of Iron” — the genocide of the last ten months and counting. 

The poll asks, among else, how people would want to handle the soldiers suspected of [gang-raping Palestinian detainees at the Sde Teiman torture facility](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/08/israeli-medias-coverage-of-the-rape-of-palestinian-detainees-shows-support-for-sexual-violence-in-service-of-genocide/)
 if it turned out that the suspicions were strong. It confirms what we saw last week when Israeli journalist Yehuda Shlezinger lamented on Israel’s mainstream Channel 12 [how gang rape is not an approved and regulated policy](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/08/israeli-medias-coverage-of-the-rape-of-palestinian-detainees-shows-support-for-sexual-violence-in-service-of-genocide/)
 in Israeli detention centers. 

That figure, 65%, also echoes the February [poll](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/02/over-2-3-of-jewish-israelis-oppose-humanitarian-aid-to-palestinians-starving-in-gaza/)
 saying that 68% of Jewish Israelis  “oppose the transfer of humanitarian aid to Gaza residents at this time,” even if Hamas or UNRWA were out of the picture in terms of distribution. 

The same INSS poll citing the 65% opposing criminal prosecution of the gang rapists incidentally cites an identical percentage of Israeli Jews as having “high trust” in the reports of the military spokesperson “throughout the war in Gaza” — an institution which generates incessant [genocide propaganda](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/03/the-real-reason-israel-stormed-al-shifa-hospital-yet-again/)
. There, they only offer a data tracker on six points, but it doesn’t include the Hebrew survey with its 23 points. 

So this is yet another unbelievable data point — gang rape as a weapon of war is not considered criminal by two out of three Jewish Israelis when it’s Israeli soldiers doing it to Palestinians (in the much-publicized gang rape case, the victim happens to be a civil servant, a policeman for the drug control department in Jabalia). 

When it comes to Palestinians, the blanket suspicion of affiliation with Hamas generates a rationale for revenge by which Palestinians are assumed to be involved with sexual violence, and when we speak about “disciplinary measures” here, it is not just systemic torture and sexual violence, it also reaches the level of murder through torture. Two-thirds of Jewish Israelis are saying that there is simply nothing criminal here — only “bad behavior,” at worst. 

And this seems to strengthen the pattern that has been documented: not only do Israelis seem to generally enjoy watching [snuff videos](https://mondoweiss.net/2024/03/we-are-the-masters-of-the-house-israeli-channels-air-snuff-videos-featuring-systematic-torture-of-palestinians/)
 of this systemic torture — they generally support the sexual violence, including rape, that has accompanied it. In addition to wishing a “regulated policy” of rape existed in Israeli prisons, Shlezinger also advocated that the “terrorists” be “executed according to law.” And he shared that belief during his _apology_ for his rape advocacy.

It is a whole other world of impunity for Israeli soldiers. 65%, almost two out of three Jewish Israelis, opposed criminal prosecution, and would prefer them be “handled in a disciplinary manner, by the commanding level only.”

The survey asked the question:

> “Recently, the military prosecution requested to extend the arrest of the five soldiers suspected of gross abuse, and clarified that there is added evidence which strengthens the suspicion against them. In your opinion, if it turns out that there is basis for the suspicion against the suspects, in which way should they be handled?” 

Only 21% of Jewish Israelis answered that “they should stand criminal trial”; 14% of Jewish Israelis didn’t know.  

It is now clear, that the torture of Palestinians in this network of torture camps is systemic, as also documented by B’tselem in their report “[Welcome to Hell: The Israeli Prison System as a Network of Torture Camps](https://www.btselem.org/press_releases/20240805_welcome_to_hell)
.” High brass is involved in this, so the idea that the gang rapists would be disciplined by their own commanders is tantamount to letting them off the hook. They can trust the military to protect the rapists. 

The full INSS survey in Hebrew is not on the [English version](https://www.inss.org.il/publication/war-data/)
 of the site. There is almost nothing they can do to Palestinians that the Jewish Israeli public would consider criminal, and hardly any Israelis would consider them “human animals” for thinking like that. 

_Correction: The story originally incorrectly said that “28% of Jewish Israelis answered that ‘they should stand criminal trial.'” The correct percentage is 21%. The story has been updated._

The poll, conducted by the Israeli Institute for National Security Studies, surveyed attitudes regarding the "Swords of Iron" operation. The article also mentions a Channel 12 report.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions

* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:54> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic question from Israel's Channel 12 public opinion poll: 'Do you agree with the claim that a solder is allowed to rape a prisoner with his hands tied?'"

## Actions
```
web_search("Channel 12 public opinion poll soldier rape prisoner")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The image is a doctored screenshot of a poll. The original footage was published by Channel 12 on May 27, 2022. The doctored image asked if a soldier is allowed to rape a Palestinian. Channel 12 did not broadcast the purported poll. The original question was: “Do you agree with the claim that the government relies on supporters of terrorism?” (<image:6696>, <image:6694>, <image:6695>).

The National Desk discusses a doctored image of a poll, which was shared by Rep. Erakat, seemingly conducted by Israel's Channel 12 (<image:6699>). An article from Mondoweiss discusses a poll indicating that 65% of Jewish Israelis oppose criminal prosecution for soldiers suspected of raping Palestinian detainees. The poll was conducted by the Israeli Institute for National Security Studies.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. The image is a doctored screenshot of a poll. The original footage was published by Channel 12 on May 27, 2022. The doctored image asked if a soldier is allowed to rape a Palestinian. Channel 12 did not broadcast the purported poll. The original question was: “Do you agree with the claim that the government relies on supporters of terrorism?”

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:54> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic question from Israel's Channel 12 public opinion poll: 'Do you agree with the claim that a solder is allowed to rape a prisoner with his hands tied?'"

## Actions
```

```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The image is a doctored screenshot of a poll. The original footage was published by Channel 12 on May 27, 2022. The doctored image asked if a soldier is allowed to rape a Palestinian. Channel 12 did not broadcast the purported poll. The original question was: “Do you agree with the claim that the government relies on supporters of terrorism?” (<image:6696>, <image:6694>, <image:6695>).

The National Desk discusses a doctored image of a poll, which was shared by Rep. Erakat, seemingly conducted by Israel's Channel 12 (<image:6699>). An article from Mondoweiss discusses a poll indicating that 65% of Jewish Israelis oppose criminal prosecution for soldiers suspected of raping Palestinian detainees. The poll was conducted by the Israeli Institute for National Security Studies.


## Elaboration
The claim is false. The image is a doctored screenshot of a poll. The original footage was published by Channel 12 on May 27, 2022. The doctored image asked if a soldier is allowed to rape a Palestinian. Channel 12 did not broadcast the purported poll. The original question was: “Do you agree with the claim that the government relies on supporters of terrorism?”


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is a doctored screenshot of a poll that was not broadcast by Channel 12. The original question was different from the one presented in the image.

`false`

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:54> The image shows a screenshot of an authentic question from Israel's Channel 12 public opinion poll: 'Do you agree with the claim that a solder is allowed to rape a prisoner with his hands tied?'"

## Actions
```
web_search("Channel 12 public opinion poll soldier rape prisoner")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The image is a doctored screenshot of a poll. The original footage was published by Channel 12 on May 27, 2022. The doctored image asked if a soldier is allowed to rape a Palestinian. Channel 12 did not broadcast the purported poll. The original question was: “Do you agree with the claim that the government relies on supporters of terrorism?” (<image:6696>, <image:6694>, <image:6695>).

The National Desk discusses a doctored image of a poll, which was shared by Rep. Erakat, seemingly conducted by Israel's Channel 12 (<image:6699>). An article from Mondoweiss discusses a poll indicating that 65% of Jewish Israelis oppose criminal prosecution for soldiers suspected of raping Palestinian detainees. The poll was conducted by the Israeli Institute for National Security Studies.


## Elaboration
The claim is false. The image is a doctored screenshot of a poll. The original footage was published by Channel 12 on May 27, 2022. The doctored image asked if a soldier is allowed to rape a Palestinian. Channel 12 did not broadcast the purported poll. The original question was: “Do you agree with the claim that the government relies on supporters of terrorism?”


## Final Judgement
The image is a doctored screenshot of a poll that was not broadcast by Channel 12. The original question was different from the one presented in the image.

`false`


## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is a doctored screenshot of a poll that was not broadcast by Channel 12. The original footage, published on May 27, 2022, featured a different question than the one presented in the image, which falsely claimed to ask about a soldier's permission to rape a prisoner. The original question was: “Do you agree with the claim that the government relies on supporters of terrorism?”

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()


SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. # Search Result
From [Source](https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahu-says-israel-is-ready-to-support-lebanon-in-disarming-hezbollah/): 
Content: "(Ayal Margolin/Flash90)

Israel is “ready to support” Lebanon’s efforts to disarm Hezbollah and will implement a phased reduction of its military presence in Lebanon as a “reciprocal measure,” the Prime Minister’s Office said in a statement on Monday.

If the Lebanese Armed Forces “take the necessary steps to implement the disarmament of Hezbollah, Israel will engage in reciprocal measures, including a phased reduction of IDF presence in coordination with the US-led security mechanism,” the statement reads.

“Israel stands ready to support Lebanon in its efforts to disarm Hezbollah and to work together towards a more secure and stable future for both nations,” it continued.

The comments issued by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office come nine months after Israel and Lebanon reached a ceasefire deal following a year of cross-border fighting that escalated in September 2024 before the agreement was signed in November. On Monday, Hezbollah leader Naim Qassem reaffirmed the group’s refusal to disarm.

The Prime Minister’s Office statement praised leaders in Beirut for their “momentous decision,” calling the move “a crucial opportunity for Lebanon to reclaim its sovereignty and restore the authority of its state institutions, military, and governance—free from the influence of non-state actors.”

Advertisement

The statement came a day after top US envoy Tom Barrack, accompanied by US Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee, reportedly met in Jerusalem with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other senior officials to discuss Syria and Lebanon.

Barrack said in Beirut last week that [Israel should honor its commitments](https://www.timesofisrael.com/us-envoy-israeli-withdrawal-from-lebanon-next-step-as-beirut-agrees-to-disarm-hezbollah/)
 under a November 2024 ceasefire, in light of Beirut’s decision to work toward Hezbollah’s disarmament.

“I think the Lebanese government has done their part. Israel has maintained a military presence in five key points in southern Lebanon and continues to strike Hezbollah targets in the country.

On Monday, alongside the comments from Netanyahu’s office, a Hezbollah operative was killed in an Israeli drone strike in the southern Lebanon town of Tebnine, the military said.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu office Hezbollah August 2024")
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story): 
Content: "[Skip to main content](#maincontent)
[Skip to navigation](#navigation)
[Skip to navigation](#navigation)

!A Hezbollah UAV crossing from Lebanon is intercepted by an Israeli fighter jet and explodes <image:6712>

0:41

Strikes on Hezbollah 'not the end of the story', says Netanyahu – video

This article is more than **1 year old**

Netanyahu says attacks on Hezbollah in Lebanon ‘not the end of the story’
=========================================================================

This article is more than 1 year old

Israeli air raids on rocket sites are part of dangerous rise in hostilities, increasing fears a major conflict could erupt

Benjamin Netanyahu has vowed that Israeli air raids targeting Hezbollah rockets in southern Lebanon in the early hours of Sunday morning were “not the end of the story”, after the two sides [exchanged their heaviest fire](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/israel-hezbollah-attacks-what-we-know-so-far)
 since the war in Gaza began, raising fears of an all-out regional conflict.

The Israeli prime minister did not specify what further action, if any, was planned after the intense exchanges but he suggested Israel’s moves would be aimed at “changing the situation in the north”.

The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) used 100 jet fighters that [hit more than 40 target sites inside Lebanon](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/israel-pre-emptive-strikes-lebanon-huge-hezbollah-drone-and-rocket-attack)
 in sorties over [a period of seven hours](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/south-lebanon-reels-from-israel-aerial-barrage-hezbollah)
. He also discussed the UK’s important role in maintaining regional stability, and in this regard emphasised the importance of preventing regional escalation.”

[Reuse this content](https://syndication.theguardian.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theguardian.com%2Fworld%2Farticle%2F2024%2Faug%2F25%2Fnetanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story&type=article&internalpagecode=world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story "Reuse this content")

Most viewed
-----------

Most viewed
----------- Hezbollah launched hundreds of rockets and drones at Israel.

According to Netanyahu, the raids “destroyed thousands of short-range rockets, all of which were designed to attack our citizens and our forces in the Galilee” in northern Israel.

He also said the IDF had “intercepted all of the drones that [Hezbollah](https://www.theguardian.com/world/hezbollah)
 launched at a strategic target in the centre of the country”.

Netanyahu did not name the target but the Hezbollah leader, Hassan Nasrallah, described it as “a military intelligence base 110km inside Israeli territory” just outside Tel Aviv, an apparent reference to the Glilot military base, home to the Mossad spy agency and military intelligence agencies such as the Unit 8200 electronic surveillance section.

[With Israel’s attack on Lebanon, the prospect of peace seems even further out of reach | Simon Tisdall\
\
Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/article/2024/aug/25/israels-attack-lebanon-peace-further-out-of-reach)

Two [Hezbollah](https://www.theguardian.com/world/hezbollah)
 fighters and a militant from an allied group were killed in the strikes on Lebanon. “And I reiterate – this is not the end of the story.”

Military observers in Israel believe that some IDF generals and the defence minister, Yoav Gallant, are in favour of further sorties against Hezbollah military positions following Sunday’s apparent success.

!Moment of strike in Lebanon as Israel and Hezbollah exchange heavy fire – video <image:6715>

0:48

Moment of strike in Lebanon as Israel and Hezbollah exchange heavy fire – video

Gallant told IDF officers that Hezbollah had been thrown off balance by pre-emptive Israeli action minutes before the Lebanese militia was due to launch its rocket and drone attack.

“We have destabilized Hezbollah, and their operation failed,” he said, according to [Haaretz newspaper](https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2024-08-25/ty-article-live/idf-launches-wave-of-lebanon-strikes-as-israel-braces-for-major-hezbollah-escalation/00000191-8715-d632-add9-b7778aa50000?liveBlogItemId=373173373#373173373)
. He added that all the drones involved had been successfully launched and had entered Israeli airspace, but did not say how many, if any, had reached their intended target.

The Hezbollah secretary general claimed the Lebanese Shia militia had decided not to respond to the [killing in late July of its commander](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/jul/30/beirut-suburbs-hit-in-airstrike-targeting-hezbollah-commander-israel-says)
, Fuad Shukr, with attacks on Israeli civilians or infrastructure but to focus on exclusively military targets.

!Hezbollah and Israel exchange strikes as tensions escalate – video report <image:6714>

2:04

Hezbollah and Israel exchange strikes as tensions escalate – video report

He added that Hezbollah’s arsenal of guided missiles had not been used and had not been damaged by Israeli airstrikes, so could be used in the future. Israel’s foreign minister, Israel Katz, also stressed his country did not want an all-out conflict, though it would “act according to developments on the ground”.

[Map](https://interactive.guim.co.uk/uploader/embed/2024/08/israel_lebanon_strikes-map/giv-13425f8aHmj5xK1D8/)

However, Netanyahu’s government is under persistent political pressure to create conditions in northern Israel for 80,000 displaced residents to return to their homes. They had been driven out by Hezbollah rocket and artillery fire in solidarity with Hamas, after the Palestinian militant group launched its surprise attack on Israel on 7 October last year.

“Nasrallah in Beirut and \[Iranian supreme leader\] Khamenei in Tehran need to know that this is an additional step in changing the situation in the north, and returning our residents securely to their homes,” Netanyahu told a cabinet meeting on Sunday. He argued that Israel was at a “strategic crossroads” between possible negotiated solutions to the conflict in Gaza and the confrontation with Hezbollah in [Lebanon](https://www.theguardian.com/world/lebanon)
.

“We need to use the negotiations to bring about the release of hostages, and through the release of the hostages, also open the possibility of creating a resolution in the north, and later, to calm the region,” the defence minister said.

[Israel and Hezbollah have good reason to avoid war – but it remains possible\
\
Read more](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/israel-and-hezbollah-have-good-reason-to-avoid-war-but-it-remains-possible)

Meanwhile, Israel was “operating militarily and preparing as if we will not reach a resolution, and we are ready at any moment for war in the north, whatever may come”, Gallant said. The French press agency AFP quoted an unnamed US military official as saying that Washington had helped track incoming Hezbollah attacks but “was not involved in Israel’s pre-emptive strikes”.

Gallant’s office reported that the minister had talked by phone to the UK defence secretary, John Healey, to brief him on the pre-emptive airstrikes and the thwarted Hezbollah attack.

“Minister Gallant discussed the important cooperation with Britain in ensuring Israel’s security,” the ministry statement said. An Israeli navy officer was killed and two other service members injured on a patrol boat off the coast of northern Israel that was hit by shrapnel from an Iron Dome interceptor missile.

On Sunday evening the armed wing of Hamas said that it had fired an “M90” rocket at Tel Aviv in response to what it said was the “Israeli massacres against civilians”.

The IDF said sirens sounded in Rishon LeTsiyon, about 15 miles south of Tel Aviv, but the rocket landed “in an open area”.

A Hamas official also said on Sunday evening that it rejected new Israeli conditions put forward in [Gaza](https://www.theguardian.com/world/gaza)
 ceasefire talks, casting further doubt on the chances of a breakthrough in the latest US-backed effort."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Guardian published an article on August 25, 2024, discussing the exchange of fire between Israel and Hezbollah. The article includes a video of Benjamin Netanyahu and mentions that he stated that the attacks on Hezbollah in Lebanon were "not the end of the story." <image:6712>. The article also mentions that the IDF used 100 jet fighters that hit more than 40 target sites inside Lebanon. <image:6715>, <image:6714>.

War with Hezbollah was inevitable, given the Sword of Damocles it held over Israel’s head, but, as in the case of Gaza, Netanyahu was risk-averse.

His security doctrine rested on deterrence — managing the threat rather than eliminating it — because an all-out war was expected to bring massive destruction and thousands of civilian casualties. Hoping to avert a wider war, the president convinced Netanyahu to call off the attack (Netanyahu denied the report).

Hezbollah intensified its bombardment with rockets that Iron Dome could not intercept, forcing tens of thousands of Israelis in more than 40 communities along the border to evacuate. 11, which “could have changed the course of the war” and “eliminated all the chain of command of Hezbollah immediately.” However, Netanyahu opted for delay.

Even that success did not end the fighting. By year’s end, Hezbollah had fired 15,400 rockets.

As he would repeatedly, Netanyahu chose placating his right-wing coalition members over working with former President Joe Biden by rejecting a cease-fire proposal the Americans had coordinated with Israel. I said it because I firmly believe that the Lebanese people do not want war and can no longer bear its consequences or even the language of war.”

In August, Lebanon’s government decided to decommission Hezbollah’s weapons and assert full sovereignty over Southern Lebanon for the first time in more than 50 years.

Yet Hezbollah vows to resist. Most damning, as in Gaza, he misled Israelis into believing that “total victory” was possible.

_Mitchell Bard is a foreign policy analyst and an authority on U.S.-Israel relations who has written and edited 22 books._

Welcome!"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Washington Jewish Week published an article on August 29, 2025, discussing the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah. The article mentions that by August 2024, Hezbollah had fired over 8,000 rockets and 200 UAVs into Israel. The article also discusses the role of Benjamin Netanyahu in the conflict.

_________________________



SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu office Hezbollah August 2024")
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahu-says-israel-is-ready-to-support-lebanon-in-disarming-hezbollah/): 
Content: The Times of Israel published an article discussing Israel's readiness to support Lebanon in disarming Hezbollah. The article mentions a ceasefire deal from November 2024 and a recent drone strike by Israel on a Hezbollah operative. The article also includes images of Hezbollah supporters and US envoy Tom Barrack. The article was published in August 2025. <image:6710>, <image:6709>


From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story): 
Content: The Guardian published an article on August 25, 2024, discussing the exchange of fire between Israel and Hezbollah. The article includes a video of Benjamin Netanyahu and mentions that he stated that the attacks on Hezbollah in Lebanon were "not the end of the story." <image:6712>. The article also mentions that the IDF used 100 jet fighters that hit more than 40 target sites inside Lebanon. <image:6715>, <image:6714>.


From [Source](https://www.washingtonjewishweek.com/israel-bloodied-hezbollah-but-only-lebanon-can-defeat-it/): 
Content: The Washington Jewish Week published an article on August 29, 2025, discussing the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah. The article mentions that by August 2024, Hezbollah had fired over 8,000 rockets and 200 UAVs into Israel. The article also discusses the role of Benjamin Netanyahu in the conflict.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Times of Israel published an article in August 2025 discussing Israel's readiness to support Lebanon in disarming Hezbollah, mentioning a ceasefire deal from November 2024 and a recent drone strike by Israel on a Hezbollah operative. The article includes images of Hezbollah supporters and US envoy Tom Barrack. ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahu-says-israel-is-ready-to-support-lebanon-in-disarming-hezbollah/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahu-says-israel-is-ready-to-support-lebanon-in-disarming-hezbollah/)) <image:6710>, <image:6709>

The Guardian published an article on August 25, 2024, discussing the exchange of fire between Israel and Hezbollah, including a video of Benjamin Netanyahu, who stated that the attacks on Hezbollah in Lebanon were "not the end of the story." The article also mentions that the IDF used 100 jet fighters that hit more than 40 target sites inside Lebanon. ([https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story)) <image:6712>, <image:6715>, <image:6714> The Washington Jewish Week published an article on August 29, 2025, discussing the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, mentioning that by August 2024, Hezbollah had fired over 8,000 rockets and 200 UAVs into Israel, and also discusses the role of Benjamin Netanyahu in the conflict.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu office Hezbollah August 2024")
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: "[Sitemap](/sitemap/sitemap.xml)

Citizens need accurate information to make sound decisions. PesaCheck is Africa’s largest indigenous fact-checking organisation, debunking misleading claims and deciphering the often confusing numbers quoted by public figures in 16 African countries.

[Follow publication](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fsubscribe%2Fcollection%2Fpesa-check&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Faltered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da&collection=PesaCheck&collectionId=ab41f21aa9a9&source=post_page---post_publication_sidebar-ab41f21aa9a9-396f43e817da---------------------post_publication_sidebar------------------)

ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is fabricated
=====================================================================

**The authentic photo of the Israeli PM Netanyahu is from 2009.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------

[![PesaCheck](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fill:64:64/0*ttzO0bKO1LLBQdao.jpg)](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--396f43e817da---------------------------------------)

[PesaCheck](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--396f43e817da---------------------------------------)

4 min read

·

1 day ago

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fvote%2Fpesa-check%2F396f43e817da&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Faltered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da&user=PesaCheck&userId=c75918c2df6e&source=---header_actions--396f43e817da---------------------clap_footer------------------)

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fbookmark%2Fp%2F396f43e817da&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Faltered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da&source=---header_actions--396f43e817da---------------------bookmark_footer------------------)

Listen

Share

A [photo published on X](https://archive.is/0PvDl)
 (formerly Twitter) claiming to show Israeli Prime Minister (PM) Benjamin Netanyahu being surveilled by Iran from inside his office is ALTERED.

The post alleges that Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) captured and published the image, accompanied by a warning reading, “Do not test our capabilities — we intend to keep you living in a state of constant anxiety!”

However, a reverse image search revealed that the photo has [been online](https://archive.is/JmjZG)
 since 2019 and was not shared by IRGC in 2025, as the post claims.

Furthermore, a Yandex image search showed that the photo was [edited](https://www.malumatfurus.org/netanyahu-makam-odasi/)
 to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance. The [original image](https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/in-this-handout-photo-benjamin-netanyahu-head-of-the-right-news-photo/84719768?adppopup=true)
, taken on 8 February 2009, in Jerusalem, shows Netanyahu with his father, Ben Zion Netanyahu.

A FotoForensics Error Level Analysis (ELA) reveals that the photo has been altered, as indicated by inconsistencies and noise in the image.

PesaCheck has looked into a photo on X (formerly Twitter) claiming to show Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu being surveilled by Iran from inside his office and finds it to have been ALTERED.

_This post is part of an ongoing series of PesaCheck fact-checks examining content marked as_ **_potential misinformation_** _on Facebook and other social media platforms._

[_By partnering with Facebook and similar social media platforms_](/pesacheck-and-facebook-partner-to-fight-misinformation-in-kenya-d6a45ee70c18?gi=d2cb1ae7440)
_, third-party fact-checking organisations like PesaCheck are helping to sort fact from fiction. We do this by giving the public deeper insight and context to posts they see in their social media feeds._

_Have you spotted what you think is fake or false information on Facebook?_ [_Here’s how you can report_](https://www.facebook.com/help/572838089565953?helpref=faq_content)
_. And,_ [_here’s_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _more information on_ [_PesaCheck’s methodology_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _for fact-checking questionable content._

_This fact-check was written by Senior PesaCheck fact-checker_ [**_Pius Enywaru_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/enywaru/)
 _and edited by PesaCheck copy editor_ [**_Paul Tajuba_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/paul-tajuba-93b62a82/)
 _and_ _chief copy editor_ [**_Stephen Ndegwa_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/stephen-ndegwa-0b32b126b/)
**_._**

_The article was approved for publication by PesaCheck managing editor_ [**_Doreen Wainainah_**](https://twitter.com/DoreenWainainah)
**_._**

_PesaCheck is East Africa’s first public finance fact-checking initiative. It was co-founded by_ [**_Catherine Gicheru_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/catherine-gicheru)
 _and_ [**_Justin Arenstein_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/justin-arenstein)
_, and is being incubated by the continent’s largest civic technology and data journalism accelerator:_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_. It seeks to help the public separate fact from fiction in public pronouncements about the numbers that shape our world, with a special emphasis on pronouncements about public finances that shape government’s delivery of Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) public services, such as healthcare, rural development and access to water / sanitation._ [**_PesaCheck_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
 _also tests the accuracy of media reportage. To find out more about the project, visit_ [**_pesacheck.org_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
_._

_PesaCheck is an initiative of_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_, through its_ [**_innovateAFRICA fund_**](https://innovateafrica.fund/)
_, with support from_ [**_Deutsche Welle Akademie_**](https://www.dw.com/en/dw-akademie/about-us/)
_, in partnership with a coalition of local African media and other civic watchdog organisations._

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from PesaCheck states that the image is fabricated. The original photo was taken on February 8, 2009, and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article also mentions that the image was edited to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance.

_________________________



DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu office Hezbollah August 2024")
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Times of Israel published an article in August 2025 discussing Israel's readiness to support Lebanon in disarming Hezbollah, mentioning a ceasefire deal from November 2024 and a recent drone strike by Israel on a Hezbollah operative. The article includes images of Hezbollah supporters and US envoy Tom Barrack. ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahu-says-israel-is-ready-to-support-lebanon-in-disarming-hezbollah/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahu-says-israel-is-ready-to-support-lebanon-in-disarming-hezbollah/)) <image:6710>, <image:6709>

The Guardian published an article on August 25, 2024, discussing the exchange of fire between Israel and Hezbollah, including a video of Benjamin Netanyahu, who stated that the attacks on Hezbollah in Lebanon were "not the end of the story." The article also mentions that the IDF used 100 jet fighters that hit more than 40 target sites inside Lebanon. ([https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story)) <image:6712>, <image:6715>, <image:6714> The Washington Jewish Week published an article on August 29, 2025, discussing the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, mentioning that by August 2024, Hezbollah had fired over 8,000 rockets and 200 UAVs into Israel, and also discusses the role of Benjamin Netanyahu in the conflict.


### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image is fabricated. The original photo was taken on February 8, 2009, and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article also mentions that the image was edited to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim that the image shows Benjamin Netanyahu in his office captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024 is false. The reverse image search reveals that the image is fabricated and was edited to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance. The original photo was taken in 2009.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu office Hezbollah August 2024")
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Times of Israel published an article in August 2025 discussing Israel's readiness to support Lebanon in disarming Hezbollah, mentioning a ceasefire deal from November 2024 and a recent drone strike by Israel on a Hezbollah operative. The article includes images of Hezbollah supporters and US envoy Tom Barrack. ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahu-says-israel-is-ready-to-support-lebanon-in-disarming-hezbollah/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahu-says-israel-is-ready-to-support-lebanon-in-disarming-hezbollah/)) <image:6710>, <image:6709>

The Guardian published an article on August 25, 2024, discussing the exchange of fire between Israel and Hezbollah, including a video of Benjamin Netanyahu, who stated that the attacks on Hezbollah in Lebanon were "not the end of the story." The article also mentions that the IDF used 100 jet fighters that hit more than 40 target sites inside Lebanon. ([https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story)) <image:6712>, <image:6715>, <image:6714> The Washington Jewish Week published an article on August 29, 2025, discussing the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, mentioning that by August 2024, Hezbollah had fired over 8,000 rockets and 200 UAVs into Israel, and also discusses the role of Benjamin Netanyahu in the conflict.


### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image is fabricated. The original photo was taken on February 8, 2009, and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article also mentions that the image was edited to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance.


## Elaboration
The claim that the image shows Benjamin Netanyahu in his office captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024 is false. The reverse image search reveals that the image is fabricated and was edited to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance. The original photo was taken in 2009.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is fabricated, and the claim is not factually accurate. The original photo was taken in 2009 and edited to create the impression of surveillance. `false`
_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu office Hezbollah August 2024")
reverse_search(<image:56>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Times of Israel published an article in August 2025 discussing Israel's readiness to support Lebanon in disarming Hezbollah, mentioning a ceasefire deal from November 2024 and a recent drone strike by Israel on a Hezbollah operative. The article includes images of Hezbollah supporters and US envoy Tom Barrack. ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahu-says-israel-is-ready-to-support-lebanon-in-disarming-hezbollah/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahu-says-israel-is-ready-to-support-lebanon-in-disarming-hezbollah/)) <image:6710>, <image:6709>

The Guardian published an article on August 25, 2024, discussing the exchange of fire between Israel and Hezbollah, including a video of Benjamin Netanyahu, who stated that the attacks on Hezbollah in Lebanon were "not the end of the story." The article also mentions that the IDF used 100 jet fighters that hit more than 40 target sites inside Lebanon. ([https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story](https://www.theguardian.com/world/article/2024/aug/25/netanyahu-says-attacks-on-hezbollah-in-lebanon-not-the-end-of-the-story)) <image:6712>, <image:6715>, <image:6714> The Washington Jewish Week published an article on August 29, 2025, discussing the conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, mentioning that by August 2024, Hezbollah had fired over 8,000 rockets and 200 UAVs into Israel, and also discusses the role of Benjamin Netanyahu in the conflict.


### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image is fabricated. The original photo was taken on February 8, 2009, and shows Benjamin Netanyahu with his father. The article also mentions that the image was edited to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance.


## Elaboration
The claim that the image shows Benjamin Netanyahu in his office captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024 is false. The reverse image search reveals that the image is fabricated and was edited to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance. The original photo was taken in 2009.


## Final Judgement
The image is fabricated, and the claim is not factually accurate. The original photo was taken in 2009 and edited to create the impression of surveillance. `false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is false. The image is fabricated, as confirmed by a reverse image search, which revealed that the original photo was taken in 2009 and edited to depict surveillance of Benjamin Netanyahu. The evidence from [PesaCheck](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da) confirms the image's alteration.

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:58> This image shows the aftermath of a Houthi attack on Tel Aviv, Israel, in July 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:58>)
web_search("Houthi attack Tel Aviv July 2024")
```
_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:58> This image shows the aftermath of a Houthi attack on Tel Aviv, Israel, in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:58>)
web_search("Houthi attack Tel Aviv July 2024")
```

0min

Explosion in Tel Aviv building, bomb disposal experts on site: Israeli police

A powerful explosion of unknown origin went off in a building in Tel Aviv before 4:00 am (0100 GMT), Israeli police said Friday.  
  
"Numerous police officers and bomb disposal experts have arrived on the scene and are dealing with the situation," police said in a statement without giving further details.  
  
AFP

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The LBC Group website published an article on July 19, 2024, reporting an explosion in a Tel Aviv building. <image:2339> The article mentions that Israeli police and bomb disposal experts were on the scene.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:58> This image shows the aftermath of a Houthi attack on Tel Aviv, Israel, in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:58>)
web_search("Houthi attack Tel Aviv July 2024")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog-october-7-2023/): Found exact image on website with title: Oct. 7: Hamas terrorists burst through border, slaughter Israelis in ...
Content: "[Skip to main content](#main-content)
